results.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Ken Hughes, Albert R. Broccoli, Dramatic Features and Warfield Productions
results.brief_description: The author of James Bond, Ian Fleming, wrote this charming story of a car that could fly. This is a wonderful musical/comedy fantasy for the whole family starring Dick Van Dyke and Gert Frobe. It is recreated for the screen by the director Ken Hughes of “Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Adam, Ken Hughes, Albert R. Broccoli, Dramatic Features and Warfield Productions

results.title: Chip Carving
results.brief_description: Chip carving is a wonderfully direct and simple way to decorate furniture, cabinets, boxes and plaques. Discusses the basics: how to approach design, sharpen the knife, hold a consistent angle and use it to carve four different borders, a rosette and a free form.
results.description: Chip carving is a wonderfully direct and simple way to decorate furniture, cabinets, boxes and plaques. Discusses the basics: how to approach design, sharpen the knife, hold a consistent angle and use it to carve four different borders, a rosette and a free form.

results.title: Chopper [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Dominik, Michele Bennett and Palace Films
results.brief_description: This AFI award winning film is based on the life of Mark Brandon - “Chopper” - Read, a notorious Australian criminal who became a best selling author, publishing 9 books of his life and times as a key stand man in Melbourne’s underworld. Eric Bana plays Chopper following his conviction for abducting a judge who was proceeding over the case of his best friend, Jimmy Loughnan (Simon Lyndon). Read ends up serving a 16 year sentence for his efforts, during which he shares a cell with Jimmy and has to contend with Keithy George (David Field), a crime boss who runs the prison. After an attack of violence instigated by Chopper, he kills Keithy and finds himself the target of numerous prisoners wishing revenge on him. As he sees it, the only way to escape the notorious H division is to get his friend to chop his ears off so that he can be transferred to another prison. Eight years later, Chopper is released and finds himself battling his own personal demons and psychotic episodes to try and adjust to outside life. All he can focus on is seeking revenge on arch enemy Neville Bartos (Vince Colosimo) and looking out for his girlfriend, Tanya (Kate Beahan). This special edition includes deleted scenes, theatrical trailer and footage of director Andrew Dominik and Eric Bana’s visit to Chopper in Tasmania while researching the film.

results.title: Chocky
results.creator_credit: Vic Hughes, Christopher Hodson and Thorn EMI
results.brief_description: Matthew Gore’s life is just like any other 12 year olds, until he meets ‘Chocky’. What makes Chocky different from Matthew’s other friends is that she cannot be seen, speaks inside Matthew’s head and is an explorer from another world. Matthew develops new physical and mental capabilities through Chocky’s guidance, however it also isolates him from family and friends and eventually throws him into the media spotlight. Matthew is forced to make some adult decisions about his unique friend and their relationship. Based on the novel by renowned science fiction writer John Wyndham.

results.title: Chinese roulette = Chinesisches roulette
results.creator_credit: Rainer Werner Fassbinder, Les Films du Losange and Albatros
results.brief_description: An intense, psychological comedy/drama about a disabled girl, Angela (Andrea Schober), who plots to get herself, both her parents (Alexander Allerson and Margit Cristensen), and their respective lovers (Anna Karina and Ulli Lommel) to the family’s country house all at the same time. The scene is set for a weekend of intense embarassments and confrontations, climaxing in the game of psychological warfare, Chinese Roulette. Typically Fassbinder, the film is a biting attack on the institution of marriage and on middle-class morality. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: China mission
results.creator_credit: Tom Radford, Lydia Semotuk, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A biography of Chester Ronning told through the use of mostly contemporary stills and some silent footage. Chester Ronning was born in Francheng, China, in 1894, the son of Norwegian missionaries. Until his death at the age of ninety, he was everything from a cowboy to an ambassador, a college president to a Peace River homesteader, a missionary to a member of the Alberta legislature. But Ronning, who died in December 1984, is best remebered in international circles for his long and close relationship with China. Throughout his many careers, including that of Canadian High Commissioner to India, ambassador to Norway, and head of an international mission in 1966 to end the war in Vietnam, Ronning’s lifelong ambition was to explain China to the western world. His story is a rare example of the meeting of east and west in a compassionate, remarkable man. Narrated by Cedric Smith. (Awards: San Antonio; San Francisco).

results.title: Chillysmith farm
results.creator_credit: Dan Jury, Mark Jury and Valley Filmworks
results.brief_description: Chillysmith Farm was the home of Gramp, whose last years were documented by his grandsons in the photo essay ‘Gramp’. In this film, 10 years in the making, Gramp and other members of his family are shown. Birth and death are shown by the whole family. This is a film for all ages that raises issues of family life, birth, death, and individual responsibility of the ageing.

results.title: Children of the tribe
results.creator_credit: Kalle Lasn, Peter Jones, John Coney, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film about parenting and education in Japan, Children of the Tribe brings out the striking contrasts between Japanese and Western family life and schooling, and illustrates the two seemingly contradictory elements of Japanese society: great competitiveness and great dependence on the group. Nuances of manner and behavior are recorded in a way that will inspire thoughtful consideration of the collective experience.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kalle Lasn, Peter Jones, John Coney, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Children of the revolution
results.creator_credit: Peter Duncan, Tristram Miall and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: ‘Children of the Revolution’ is a delightful comedy which takes an irreverent look at political idealism. When Joan Fraser (Judy Davis), a zealous communist, visits Stalin in Moscow it’s the height of the Menzies era. She returns to Australia pregnant. Could her Stalinist love child change the course of Australian history? Wonderful performances from Judy Davis and Sam Neill (in an ironic twist on their roles in ‘My Brilliant Career’!) as well as Geoffrey Rush, Richard Roxburgh, Rachel Griffiths and F. Murray Abraham as Stalin.
